Source   Edit  

SeqFu common methods

This module provides common methods for manipulating and analyzing sequence data in FASTA/FASTQ format. It includes functions for trimming, quality scoring, reverse complementing, and calculating GC content.

Imports

seqtypes

Procs

proc avgQuality(quality: string; offset: int = 33): float {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}

Calculate the average quality of a quality string

Args: quality: Quality string offset: Quality score offset (default is 33 for Sanger/Illumina 1.8+)

Returns: Average quality score as a float

Returns: Average quality score as a float

proc composition(record: FQRecord): SeqComp {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculate composition of a DNA Sequence Returns a SeqComp object with counts of A, C, G, T, N, and Other (int) and GC content (float) Source   Edit   
proc filtPolyX(read: FQRecord; minLen: int = 10; trackStats: bool = false): FQRecord {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Removes homopolymer runs (poly-X) from the 3' end of a read.

Parameters: read: The input sequence read minLen: Minimum length of homopolymer run to trigger trimming (default: 10) trackStats: Whether to track statistics about trimming (not implemented in this version)

Returns: A new FQRecord with poly-X tails trimmed if needed

Source   Edit

Args: sequence: DNA sequence
